caption: Restaurant week and Sephia popped in my radar. We were lucky to get a reservation. The atmosphere and ambiance is top notch. The service was awesome! Very attentive. The food was excellent!!! Now, I started missing Blackbird. I wish they survived this pandemic. Thank you Sepia. We really enjoyed ourselves. Will be back!
An amazing dinner. They were very on point with the covid protocol and still made the night memorable.
Amazing flavors!
This mixologist knows what he is doing!
"This place gives wonderful service as well as tasty food."

Started off with the complimentary bread and the butter - always a great start. To start, I went with the Tagliatelle, which came with pheasant sugo and black trumpet mushrooms. The tagliatelle was perfectly al dente and the mushrooms were so savory. Really enjoyed this pasta + cod combo!

A West Loop resident long before Fulton Market became Chicago’s hottest hangout, Sepia’s reopening sees the Restaurant operating in a new era of social distancing and time limits while the current $65 prix fixe may just be the Windy City’s best Michelin-starred bargain. Housed in a 19th century print shop since 2007, restaurateur Emmanuel Nony smartly recruiting Executive Chef Andrew Zimmerman in 2009 and since earning accolades from the French tire guide, JBF and Jean Banchet Awards, diners visiting Sepia in the era of Covid-19 will begin their evening with checked temperatures followed by city-mandates necessitating masks be worn any time staff approach the table with fresh serviceware or even a refill of Water.

What a fantastic experience dining at Sepia! Beautiful, intricate and refined dishes, and an eclectic cocktail list made for a wonderful dinner experience, that ended with very tasty dessert.  Service was friendly and attentive. Would highly recommend!  Added: pictures from our recent takeout experience, which, while a bit involved, was also really spectacular food-wise!  To add to the review above, since the COVID-19 pandemic, we’ve tried Sepia at Home twice now and both times we’ve been stunned by how great it was.  This Thanksgiving week, we’ve tried the beautiful moist chicken breast with mustard jus, and the salmon, with multiple sides and everything was spectacular. A consistently great experience!  Edited to add: we also opted for the Sepia Christmas dinner and immensely enjoyed it. The rack of lamb was good, but the roasted root vegetables and the mashed potatoes were the real star! 😋
My top spot for tasty American food. Everyone at our table was quite pleased. Service is typically great. Prices are decent for the quality.
Nice service and great food. Such a lovely experience

From the moment you walk into Sepia, you notice the laid back, wood tone and calming atmosphere of the restaurant. That calming and intelligent design aesthetic marries perfectly with the attentive, but unassuming servers who finesse the flow of service with professionalism and knowledge. The Tasting Menu was exquisite and the perfect amount of food, if not more so. Especially good were the two mains that my husband and I had of the duck and the halibut confit. My husband said it was the best duck he’s ever had. Sepia is perfect for a fine dining experience, without the fine dining pompousness. Date night approved.
Such an amazing place to spend with your love 🥰 Great personal, delicious food and amazing atmosphere We looking forward to come back soon

My girlfriend and I had dinner on a weeknight and enjoyed our time here immensely. The food was amazing in flavor, originality and presentation. The service was extremely professional and made us feel safe during COVID and didn’t feel overbearing. We would happily recommend anyone else to come enjoy a night out here.

The most careful dining experience we have had - clearly protecting their staff and their customers, and that made us feel very comfortable - best dining-out experience we have had.   The four course offering presents varied choices that include something for almost every taste.   I don't ordinarily take the wine accompaniment but I was glad it did.  The sommelier included wines I would not normally order but which went perfectly with each course, and sized to ensure I stayed sober.  The side of corn chanterelle salad is so rich that it is almost a meal in itself.  So nice to have a constant in our dining lives.
"Fixed prix" menu is a bargain for all the different dishes you get. Food is great. Neutral decor. Friendly and unpretentious staff. Highly recommend.
Superior dining experience! Everything was excellent!
Favorite 1 Michelin star restaurant. Superb food and service. At decently affordable rates. Will come again, and you should too

One star prix fixe menu that costs less than my regular hotpot dinner so yay! Non-special food that you forget about once you leave the door, but was pretty good while you were eating. Ok cocktail. Waitress didn’t know anything about wine but was really nice and enthusiastic! If restaurant can update their menus more often this could be a good regular food spot!
Ok spot for quality American food. nice location to meet with family. the service was very sociable and kind.

A West Loop resident long before Fulton Market became Chicago’s hottest hangout, Sepia’s reopening sees the Restaurant operating in a new era of social distancing and time limits while the current $65 prix fixe may just be the Windy City’s best Michelin-starred bargain.  Housed in a 19th century print shop since 2007, restaurateur Emmanuel Nony smartly recruiting Executive Chef Andrew Zimmerman in 2009 and since earning accolades from the French tire guide, JBF and Jean Banchet Awards, diners visiting Sepia in the era of Covid-19 will begin their evening with checked temperatures followed by city-mandates necessitating masks be worn any time staff approach the table with fresh serviceware or even a refill of Water.  Undeniably inconvenient, QR Code menus another anomaly amidst this temporary “new normal,” it is largely thanks to the room’s grand appearance and gracious service that an air of refinement is retained, though the greatest part of Sepia’s appeal remains attributable to Chef Zimmerman and CDC Kyle Cottle’s Food.  Best classified as “Contemporary American,” though oftentimes globally influenced and focused on seasonal Produce, dinner began with an amuse of lemony Cucamelons amidst modernist textures, a breath of freshness quickly gone and followed by the first of two “Parker Rolls” that were nothing like the Boston namesake but nonetheless buttery and delicious.  A complimentary duo in terms of influence, Zimmerman’s training at the French Culinary Institute and time at NoMI visible in finessed flavors while Cottle’s tenure with Achatz is evidenced by manipulated textures that act to enhance rather than just “show off,” Foie Gras Mousse comes curved at $15 supplement, and eaten left-to-right explores Liver’s ability to magnify everything from earthy Sunchoke Chips to dried Shiso and juicy Cherries.  Adding another $16 for a second plate from course two, Corn Agnolotti with Pickled Blueberries and popped Sorghum suspiciously similar to Marc Vetri’s dish at Osteria Fiorella just one week prior, suffice it to say that although good it in no way compared to Chawanmushi that reminisces of Quenelles de Brochet with a velvety mouthfeel and generous amounts of Lobster.  Not about to pass on Duck, the combination of Stonefruits and Midwest Onions acting as a deft foil to complex Sauce, Dessert sees newly-acquired Pastry Chef Lauren Terrill prone to whimsy, her globally-traveled palate presenting aggressively spiced Funnel Cake with Nuts, Berries, Peaches and Citrus.

Loved it. Definitely my kind of culinary experience, the 4 courses menu with limited choices allow for enough customisation without just letting you drawn in options. Perfect. The food was excellent and nicely presented. The Sommelier was knowledgeable and offer good advice. We will be back.
Great food! Friendly staff. This is one of my go to places. I will be back
Ok spot for tasty american food. It was so tasty. I've had nothing but pleasant experiences here and plan to keep coming back. The bill was appropriate for the quality.
Unexpected.. sometimes a stroll to a close by place and having a superb experience is quite the highlight of .. this year i think.. best restaurant i have been to this year definitely..

I came with my partner and of course the 4 course dinner is what we ordered, they had the menu online, so all you had to do was hover your phone camera over a QR code to find the menu. I ordered shaved mortadella and plums for my first course, and I can certainly say that even thought it was great I preferred my partners choice which was the fluke crudo. For my second course I ordered the mushroom chawanmushi, my third was halibut and for desert, strawberry and buttermilk Panna cotta. The interior was beautiful and the staff was extremely friendly. My partner did notice that we were the only couple that had not been visited by the manager, she had greeted every table except ours, and I don't really want to take too much offense to it, but it was just unprofessional to walk around and greet the table next to ours and make eye contact with my partner and walk to the table adjacent to ours.

Fantastic dining experience. Not only did I enjoy the food but also the rustic decor. The extremely friendly and accommodating staff as well as the amazing food made my evening in Chicago a night to remember. I will definitely be back!

Thanks for celebrating me and my girl friend’s anniversay. I could fully feel that why the Sepia has been nominated as one of the Michelin guide. Although all dishes were fabulous, desserts were the best I’ve ever had. Hope to re-visit here later on

Visiting Chicago, me and my cousin felt it would be fun to go to a Michelin star restaurant. Sepia was definitely the right choice.  The experience began before we even sat foot in the store. They called ahead to ensure we has no food allergies, which is very nice of them. Walking in we were greeted by a hostesses who was super nice and took our jackets. Mind you we were dressed plainly and in our early 20's, and were treated very nicely.  The food? Was absolutely spectacular. I loved every portion of my meal. I got a lamb rack and it hit the spot in flavor. Large enough to get full and full of flavor, cooked exactly medium as I requested. They brought a Biryani, that was amazing, needless to say I was shocked they pulled that off. The potatoes gratin were great as well.  5/5 the experience, ambiance, and food were worth the modest price tag.

Fantastic staff and extremely clean. We were really impressed with how Sepia handled the dining process with virtual menus and receipts., allowing for little to no items being passed back and forth.  The food was excellent and absolutely quality.

The presentation of the food is exceptional and the food was probably good. They kept bringing drinks but no food. We waited an over hour and a half for the first course. We asked the server to please bring out the first course. He brought out more bread. It was the poor guys second day and he was confused. He wasn’t trained and didn’t have any knowledge of the menu.  After 3 hours; we left without having the fourth course served. It might have been a great experience if the food would’ve been brought out within a reasonable time or if the server wasn’t so overwhelmed and undertrained.

Take home menu during this pandemic gave us an exceptional Michelin experience on my own dining table. My wife missed dining here for a long long time so I decided to surprise my pregnant wife with their take-out menu. Couldn’t believe the excellent value for the generous price. Thoughtfully prepared and generously portioned. They got everything from appetizer to dessert. Finely decorated and absolutely delicious. We said ‘unbelievable’ more than 100times while eating.

I have been going to Sepia for many years and have always had a great experience- local food, unique combo’s, and a speakeasy vibe. We did their takeout tonight and I felt compelled to write a review. We ordered the eggplant entree for two which came with a gazpacho soup, salad, dinner rolls, broccoli, and dessert. It was flavorful and multi-dimensional. Will definitely be ordering again.

I come to this excellent place from time to time  as I like the  special atmosphere that is unique to this restaurant. The team is exceptionally loving and skilfull. The service is absolutely fast. Most important, the food they serve is good. I ate there often and I was always satisfied. The expense is reasobable. I highly suggest this restaurant to to everybody.

I tried this jewel during Restaurant Week and I can’t wait to go back. The flavors and portions were just right. They had a great lunch crowd and very good service. The coursed lunch was perfectly and I would recommend this place.
Amazing dining place with delicious food
Had a wonderful work lunch with my colleague.  The food was exquisite and the staff was extremely attentive. Thank you for  a great Michelin star experience

This was my first time ever dining at Sepia and I must say, I was impressed. Sepia is moderately priced, especially for the quality of food the are creating. The food and menu is of a different order entirely—wide variety, often locally sourced, and presented creatively. The cocktail menu was, creative and the cocktails were delicious. The wine list, had some big names, but also some hidden gems. This was very cool to see. The night that I visited the restaurant was busy, and the team looked to be understaffed. The service was good, but not what I was expecting considering what I have heard about there service. Overall, my experience was great, and I look forward to returning in the future.
Staff was phenomenal and the food was delicious
Went there for Valentine’s Day, was in my expectation! Recommend.
Great atmosphere and food
This place was great. Had a Quintessa wine tasting this night. Has a private room for parties. Had a drink in the restuarant and it was great.
Portions were really too small for the price. Interesting mix of textures and lovely plating, but flavors left some depth to be desired--appetizers and entrées overly salty, dessert rather sugary.
Delicious and beautiful food. The taste is Rich and balanced, highly recommend.
Very good food, nice spot and the people are simply a joy!
Truly delicious. Service was impeccable and the food was absolutely delicious. Everything you'd expect of a top tier restaurant.
We visited the restaurant a few days ago and we were very satisfied. The service was very attentive and the food was flavorful with a lot of finesse. Highly recommended.
Food art!  Dinner was fantastic! Alex was our server and his recommendations were spot on. Restaurant Week in Chicago!  Stop reading and make a reservation!

There is a reason for the other good reviews! Food and service were great and consistent. The wine ordered wasn’t available but it was well replaced by the sommelier. Definitely coming back and highly recommended.
This spot gives extraordinary service as well as tasty menu. My favourite spot around here. The drinks and food served quick and the rates were economical. Recommended.

Always something interesting, be it something entirely new to me, or something otherwise mundane done amazingly.  Was just there for restaurant week 2020.  If you are going, Milk-braised pork collar isnhighly recommended.  The polenta in that dish is simply amazing.
Classic style inside, with incredible food. Worth every penny.

Had the privilege of dining here during restaurant week, and was quite pleased.  Small, piquant dishes with carefully paired flavors, gracefully presented and served by friendly, knowledgeable staff. Ambiance was sophisticated without being stuffy. Great date night out.
Great food, very nice staff members, constantly excellent ambience. They charge convenient prices and the food quality is good. Fantastic work.
Food was decent enough. Duck was on the rare side. Service was very slow - took almost an hour to get orders in
This place gives wonderful service as well as tasty food. My favourite place in the area. The food served quick and the rates are fair. I recommend this place.

I believe it all starts with co-owner Donato Poto at Providence. It is clear he cares about every detail. He personally made my guests feel welcome and gave personal attention to the entire meal. He has an amazing staff who know just what to do to create a wonderful dining experience. Donato it would seem to me has hand picked the very best talent available anywhere. There is a gentleman his name was Adam who orchestrated everything to perfection, including having Donato help introduce various courses of the meal. Every detail was perfection. The outstanding reputation they have is earned every day.
One of my favorite restaurants, always a pleasurable time and amazing food
Caring atmosphere and wait staff. Interesting combination of foods.
Atmosphere is very comfortable and accommodating. Wait staff knowledgeable and very friendly. Food was exquisite. Will go back when we are in town.

We booked the table a few weeks in advance, and good that we did as the reservations fill up quickly on the weekends. I received confirmation via email and a personal call to verify any food allergies and sensitivities.  Our server was top notch and so was the dining experience. From the tender Japanese A7 Wagyu to the smokey caramel of a 30 year old Port each element complimented and built on the previous.  The atmosphere was full of sound as everyone in the room appeared to be happily conversing and enjoying themselves while the wait staff was buzzing with food and drinks.  Our table received a special taste plate from the chef that seemed unique, similar to miniature macaroons and cream. It was tart and sweet which made for the perfect palate cleanse after the appetizer of savory buttered scallops.  We didn't feel rushed, there was no pressure, and our server was patient as we asked questions and bantered about the menu. The server knew all of the menu items and was not shy about sharing opinions and making recommendations.  Dessert was worthwhile, and I won't regret the extra calories. Throughout, the house special drinks were easy to sip. My taste was for a "Gentlemen's Thief" (Rye and cider?) which was not too week, not too strong, was perfectly balanced and felt natural while waiting at the bar for our table as well as complementing the meal.  On a side note, the local Uber Black drivers knew to stay close as we were picked up within a minute or two of stepping outside.. very good for a cold evening with warm friends.
Friendly service in bustling location.  Outstanding apple and celery soup, a too salty but very good foie gras sausage and a great moist carrot cake headlined the lunch menu
Delicious food and great service.
Former employee, repeat customer, every time, exceptional service and food... Drink too...

I have been to Sepia several times. "In the beginning" it was great experience.  Fantastic food served by awesome folks.  The last few visits delivered excellent food but the service so lack luster a robot would have been preferred over our uninterested, uninvolved waiter who was able to offer no description of the dishes, how they are prepared or make recommendations when asked.  I think last week was my last visit regardless of their Michelin Star.

This was my first time ever dining at Sepia and I must say, I was impressed. Sepia is moderately priced, especially for the quality of food the are creating. The food and menu is of a different order entirely—wide variety, often locally sourced, and presented creatively. The cocktail menu was, creative and the cocktails were delicious. The wine list, had some big names, but also some hidden gems. This was very cool to see. The night that I visited the restaurant was busy, and the team looked to be understaffed. The service was good, but not what I was expecting considering what I have heard about there service. Overall, my experience was great, and I look forward to returning in the future.

This place was amazing. The host and my server Kevin were spectacular. The food was phenomenal and had me feeling like Remy in Ratatouille when he puts the food in his mouth and visualizes the taste in sounds and colors. Food shouldn't just be eaten it should be an experience and Sepia did a magnificent job in providing it.

Fantastic experience dining with 6 coworkers. It’s almost easy to miss this place, as the signage outside doesn’t immediately catch your attention, but it was a welcoming atmosphere as we were greeted just inside. We tried a little of everything the menu had to offer and were impressed with all of it. The grilled sturgeon was fantastic, and sea scallops as one if the appetizers were perhaps the best we had ever tried. Would definitely recommend, and I’m sure I’ll be back during future visits to Chicago.
My favorite Chicago restaurant. Chef matches flavors perfectly and great wine selection
Great food and service!
Excellent food and service

The food was good.   The service was terrible.   We were there for a business lunch.   It took us over 2 hours to finish the meal.   We has to ask the bus boy if we could order starters 12 min after we were seated s the waiter had not arrived. The restaurant was cleared out before we got our mains.   There was a good 5 min between the food arriving at the table for 5 of us and when the food arrived for the 6th person.   We literally had to go to the front desk to ask for dessert menus.   When they arrived, we were told we could not order a dessert of the price fix menu!    One person at our table had ordered the dessert as part of the price fix and another person wanted a slice too.  We were told they do not do that.  That about sent us off but we had another 20 min to discuss the service while we waited for the desserts to arrive.
Finest place to get something when in a rush. The service is prompt, pricing is reasonable, good vibes. I highly recommend this place
Exquisitely imagined and executed dishes; attentive service. Easy to see why they got a Michelin star!
Nice restaurant with warm welcome. Varieties of food options. Very few vegetarian options.
Good food and drinks. Also good service

I've been wanting to try this place for months, but that's because reservations is about a two month wait.  The bone marrow is a must.  I don't come here often so I never remember what I ordered until I look at my last photos.  For some reason I am always getting the agnolotti.  It always sounds so good.  And for some reason it doesn't taste the same when I first had it.  It doesn't taste bad just different.  Even the color of the meal looks different also.
Very good food for those seeking classic culinary experiences. The food is delicious, the selection of wines is great. Staff was super friendly and polite. Nice place for a special dinner.
Stopped in for the lunch prix fixe. Seasonal flavors, well-executed and balanced savory/sweet. Great service.

Have eaten here three times now. First two were for restaurant week and the third was regular menu. The first experience was the best. 1st review: Very good food. Visited for restaurant week, but will definitely return for the full menu. Service is great. Cocktails are great. Decor is classy.  The second two visits the service seemed cold and lacked the friendly touch I expect from not only Michelin rated, but from Midwest Chicago dining hospitality. The food from the second restaurant visit was lacking. The regular menu on the third visit was very good.

Really wanted to give this restaurant 5⭐ The food was good, but nothing blew my mind. Service was 4 stars. I had some questions about the origin of the fish and did not find out if it was wild or farmed. Sturgeon was nicely flavored, but a little dry. Wine pairing was 5⭐ very good selection The details of the food could have been a little bit more professional, Michelin like. It was a nice 2 hours experience in which I tasted numerous types of different food.
Best food ever! The service was perfect!
Delicious food, warm and quiet atmosphere, beautiful presentation. Very classy place!

Way too safe for a $95 five course tarting menu. The only things that stood out were the shiso wrapped hamachi crudo (which needed more spice and acid) and the admittedly perfectly cooked scallop and black pudding. Take a pass on the wine pairing, nothing stood out and several were disappointing.

I picked Sepia based on customer reviews as I wanted to find a great spot to celebrate my friends Birthday. I had high expectations being a Michelin star restaurant but needless to say it was a flop. Ambiance was average at best nothing out of ordinary the food it self was just okay. We opted for the tasting menu thinking that would be the best way to try everything however there was nothing that wowed me. For the price we've been better going to Boka or Maple & Ash where you can always expect delicious food. Service was slow and not attentive. It was a one and done for me.
Best Old Fashioned I've ever had. Great dining experience if you want a nice night out.
Really good and chef food
One of the best restaurants in Chicago. Staff is very professional and catered to every need. Nice a la carte options if you don't want to do the tasting menu. Food was absolutely outstanding.

Had a business dinner here in their private event space. The space itself is excellent and the service was solid. We had a fixed menu and I ordered the chicken and apricot tart. The salad was light and fresh but tasty. The chicken was well seasoned but a little over cooked. I did like the couscous and vegetable medley. Dessert was very tasty apricot tart but if you blinked it was gone it was so tiny. Overall, it was a tasty meal but nothing amazing.
Wonderful space, food, and wine list. I can actually hear my friends talk in the dining room. Lovely

Before anything else, I asked for a cocktail, and settled on one made with tequila, though as a general thing, I have a marked preference for mezcal.  This cocktail was appropriately made with Reposado Tequila.  For those who don't know the difference, do a little research and learn something new.  ALL tequila is mezcal, but NOT all mezcal is Tequila.  Tequila Vesper - Barrel Aged Cocktail Avion Reposado Tequila, Tito's Vodka, Salers Apertif, grapefruit oil.  TASTING MENU  Spanish mackerel, heirloom tomatoes, olive oil jam 2012 Caraccioli Cellars Brute Cuvée from the Santa Lucia Highlands  Pappardelle, lamb ragu, boquerones (anchovies), turnips, breadcrumbs 2014 Tenuta Cocci Grifoni "San Basso" Rosso Peceno Superiore from Marche, Italy  Sea scallops, salt-roasted potatoes, miso, escarole 2018 Jolie-Laide Melon de Bourgogne from their Rodnick Farm Vineyard in Chalone, California  Wagyu Beef Tri Tip, asian pears, maitakes, cabbage 2013 Red Car Syrah, Sonoma Coast, California  Chocolate Mousse, black raspberry, smoked vanilla, black raspberry ice cream NV Patrick Bottex Bugey-Cerdon "La Cueille" méthode ancestral rosé, Bugey, Ain, France  I also enjoyed a selection of cheeses after the chocolate mousse, which I specially requested because I love cheese and was in the mood to finish with it.  Staff were pleased to accommodate me, and the cheese was gratis - THANK YOU!  Everything was excellent, and I thoroughly enjoyed my wonderful meal.  It had been too long since I'd been able to sit down at a great restaurant and enjoy a delightful repast.  Sorry I don't have pics of every item, sometimes things are too appealing to permit the pause needed to take a photo!
Incredible food and very well priced for the portions you receive.
Great drinks and food, brilliant staff
Excellent service, simply amazing food preparation and presentation, good prices..a winner all around!
Great food! Lots of surprises. Ok service...
Food was great but service was very slow. I've been to 12 course tasting menus that took less time. There was a ton of time between servings. All that aside the food was great.
Wonderful. Great service. Flavorful food. Amazing wine list.

Visited in July 2019 while visiting Chicago. That was definately one of the highlights of our tour. Excellent service and menu. We decided to go with their tasting menu ($95) and wine paring ($60). Both were excellent. Wagyu beef is just to die for. Amazing! Scallops were wonderful too. The whole menu is unbelievable! Wines were amazingly paired with all dishes. The interior is classy, simple yet very beaitiful. It is a former print house, so it has that that vibe. It is pricey, (well, it has a Michelin star) but so worth the experience! Thanks for the holiday of taste!
Effortless dining at Sepia thanks to the impeccable team, both front and back of the house.
Unremarkable food with high end prices. Three little nuggets of falafel does not make an entree.
Delicious food! Good service!
Consistently excellent.
Excellent food with a generous tasting menu in this one michelin star.  Find the complete experience @rafamxcdmx on Instagram

My boyfriend took me here for a special birthday dinner and we arrived shortly before 8, were seated immediately and ordered our food shortly after.  We didn't receive our appetizers until 8:40, and then waited another 45 minutes before we got out entrees. We spent a total of 2.5 hours there and left hungry. By the time we got our entrees I was starving and couldn't even enjoy the food because I just wanted to scarf it down quickly. When I was asked by the manager about how everything was I mentioned how long the food had taken and the manager did not convey any understanding or apology and neither did our waiter. I did notice that they gave me a complimentary extra pour of wine, but that gesture really meant nothing to me because it lacked acknowledgement of why they were giving that to me. Overall the food was good, but nothing that deserved a Michelin Star and I will not be going back or recommending this place.

I'd give four stars if this were a comparison between 1-star Michelin restaurants only, but in the world of Google we are comparing Sepia on the same scale as we are comparing Burger King - and that's just not fair to a place of such high craftsmanship. I really enjoyed the reasonably priced tasting menu, I liked how the flavors played together - I would have expected 6 instead of 5 courses (excl. amouse bouches). But who am I to judge? The pappardelle were a highlight to me. The wagyu tri tip more of a marketing thing (it's a pity the chef has to measure against inspectors who expect fancy ingredients over flavor). Why not offer duck, quail, iberico or other powerful flavors instead? Cheaper for the restaurant and better for the tasters - but worse for the pretentious folks who need that Wagyu.
Decor is good, service and staff are good, food fell short of expectation. I’ll be trying proxi next to really get to know the chefs and figure their food out!

We went here for the first time during the restaurant week. Out of the whole prefix dinner menu, what we liked the best was duck liver mousse. They were very generous with the portion of the duck liver mousse. The pork loin was a bit too dry. Ocean trout was good but nothing too special.
Servers are great, but the food is on 2 stars. For this amount of money, you expect more delicate taste, and you just get tons of salt and pepper instead.
Loved it!! Everything was incredible from the food to the service.
Only the food amount is so little, I wonder I ordered the children lunch set.
Keith is a master mixologist, and the cocktails and experience reflect this.

This place was incredible! Boyfriend surprised me for my birthday (May 13) and made us reservations for dinner. From the moment we walked in, I felt welcome and excited. We ordered a couple cocktails while deciding on food - ultimately chose the tasting menu with the wine pairings - which was the best decision! Clean plate club on everything - it was all delicious!! Would definitely come back for another date night or with friends! The decor and setting is fantastic!
Tasty food and accommodating to my nut allergy! Great experience
Solid under the radar business lunch place, walking distance from the Loop
great service each time!

Delicious dinner! Great service! The falafel dish was a great vegetarian option. I also got roasted radish side dish which was absolutely delicious. The main dishes are not very large, so you will definitely want to have an appetizer or side of veggies as well.
Fantastic food and cool ambience. Probs are good and a little smaller than other places, but absolutely delicious!
Always a great meal and great service.

Took my wife here as an early Mother's day gift. What a fancy outing this was. We did the 6 course entree experience. Definitely a pricey menu but well worth it.  Very nice decor, friendly staff, just bring a fat wallet. Lol.

Excellent food and service. The Rohan duck and the Cod were both amazing. So was the scallops appetizer and the pavlova dessert. We wanted to try one Michelin star restaurant during this visit. So glad we picked Sepia.
Fancy schmancy haute cuisine. Very nice.

My wife and I came here for a quick lunch before our flight.  Not really impressed with the quality of the food.  We ordered the cheese board, burger and The cod.  I normally don’t write reviews but the fries were burnt,  the cheese choices on the board were blah and the cod had no taste.  We were expecting a wow meal but got a less than OK meal.
Bright, paced, deliberate.
The menu can be a little light, but a solid contribution to the foody scene.

Went for lunch last Thursday with my husband. I was overall disappointed.  We picked the fixed price menu. I asked our waiter if they was any way I could switch the dessert for something else like cheese for example as I'm not sweets. He didn't even bother to try or anything and said no. Appetizer was ok, I would suggest nice country bread with the mousse instead of the fried tiny toasts. It is nice to have that much of mousse, but you should give enough of bread to go with it. I picked the short ribs. My bad I didn't read the details... When the plate arrived, I figured this was actually pasta with some short ribs sauce. I switched plate with my husband who got fish. Our waiter stopped by, didn't noticed the switch... We didn't complained about anything but we should have. Food was good but our waiter was totally careless.
Average food, good service
american food, mmm, so good. I was super full. This place has a great atmosphere.
my favorite restaurant in Chicago

Andrew Zimmerman has maintained a Michelin star since he started at Sepia; since 2011. Food was impressive; service was great. Tasting menu was one of the cheapest we’d had and every single thing was good. Can’t wait to come back. They did well to take care of my gf, whom can’t do cow dairy.
High standards getting higher, can satisfy even the most refined palates. Each meal brings you such a tasty flavor. Wonderful interior design and professional staff. Worth every penny. Recommended
Amazing food, staff and decor. Love Sépia.

We order 5 items which came with a complimentary pallet cleanser (don’t do it) and dessert. I can’t say anything was delicious, in fact the duck was particularly awful with an after taste. The scallops and rabbit pasta was good - but I wouldn’t go back for the price or recommend this restaurant.
Stunning restaurant. Sexy! Some of the most pleasant and accommodating staff!!!!!  GO HERE!
A real gem.  The tasting menu is a mind-bender.  Great for client outings or a quality evening out with a significant other.
It was a great example of how a human touch of your server makes a whole experience. Alex thank you for that
Always perfect.
Very tasty modern food, nice service and delicious drinks. I will be back.

A concise menu of locally sourced foods, paired with a well curated wine list. What used to be a challenging acoustic environment has been much improved and the friendliness of the staff has been consistent over the ten+ years it's been here.
Michelin starred and for a reason. Food is mouthwateringly good. Ambience is lovely. Would definitely go back to try their tasting menu and other items!

A really stellar experience, our host and sommelier were fantastic, excellent services and great conversations. Went here for celebration dinner with my wife. Arrived a bit early and was able to get cocktails at the bar, truly on point. Great intimate spot, I was somewhat concerned that the smaller venue would have us right on top of our neighbors, but the spacing was great. Wonderful time!
The food is good.  The people are nice, but the service is very slow.  Expect to spend a minimum of 1.5-2 hrs for lunch. I have never gotten out of there in less than 1.5 hrs.

I can't believe Sepia is Michelin Restaurant. I spent about 120 $ for dinner but ended up eating extremely salty clams, and other ordinary foods. The size of the foods was small, but the foods only are okay, more like something you could purchase at 40-50$. I think Sepia didn't treat this event seriously. Sepia possibly reduced the quality of foods to deal with the reduced profit.  Also, the service was terrible. We ordered Sparking water, but during the meal, waiter added plain water to our Sparking water!!! The remaining sparking water was screw up, and that's not a mistake a Michelin Restaurant should make. Plus, the manager didn't come to ask us how was the meal. The dinner was not busy at all, so I guessed the manager didn't care a lot about the Chicago Restaurant Dinner

An elegant Michelin star restaurant. We went as part of Chicago restaurant week. The menu was tailoured for restaurant week, but I would definitely come back for the very homogenized and delicious squash soup as well as the wild rice crepes.

Went on the restaurant week 2019. We didn’t like the duck liver mousse, a little too greasy and not delicate in the flavor. I like the agnolotti and the chocolate mousse! The ocean trout is a meh, bland and doesn’t have the level of surprise in sepia.
Worthy of it's Michelin star.  Pleasant,  unpretentious service.   Enjoyed an excellent tasting menu with accompanying wine selections.  Fairly priced for what you get.

Always delivers a beautiful meal. Flawless really. Cocktails excellent. Not an inexpensive place for these reasons. But not as pretentious or painfully trying to be precious and exquisite as some of the newer places in the neighborhood.
Staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. Fantastic place for dinner and delicious seasonal cocktails. Definitely plan on returning for another meal.
Great food and drinks. Can't beat the Happy Hour.

Very tasty food historically, we only popped in for drinks this time during their happy hour. Easily one of the best old fashions in the city! Ridiculously tasty and delicious, definitely a must have if you’re there!

I went for lunch and enjoyed my meal. Starter soup was good. This place is definitely big plates, small portions type of restaurant. I loved the wood around the restaurant - the entryway,  the bar. Service staff was amazing and our waiter was knowledgeable.  I didn't give it 5 stars because I felt the meals took a long time to come out every time. The restaurant is small but they have 2 corner tables that are a little private and secluded that are a nice option. Other than that, great experience.
Excellent food. Best service and amazing cocktails.
Absolutely the best service and the tasting menu was phenomenal!
Food, drink, service and ambiance were just perfect. Loving this meal days later.
Incredible food, wine and service. Jason was amazing !
Perfect meal. Every course was nuanced and balanced down to the amuse bouche. Will be back.
Love the decor- great food and selection
Pricey and small portions - but delicious food! Worth every penny. The service and good wine menu makes it that much better. I'll be back!
Delicious variety of options in every course!

Was very excited to experience all that Sepia had to offer with a friend from out of the country.  Her first time in America.  From the moment we walked into the restaurant (the space was utilized beautifully might I add), it felt business as usual.  When I told the host of the occasion, the response was very flat and frankly not quite welcoming. We were seated and looking forward to a wonderful meal.  Then the evening took an unexpected turn.  I had to send my drink back as it was awful.  (Later I learned that mixology makes the martini alitle differently than what I am used to).  I sent it back and received pretty much the same one back.  Could not drink it.  The server Jason was not friendly at all.  Very mater of fact and not helpful. Felt as if we were taking up his time.  We decided to just order a couple of starters rather than the tasting menu (it looked exquisite).  When the starters where served, I made what I thought was a funny comment about the cheeses all being from the British isles, asked if a jig came with the service.  The response from the server was basically we are not a macaroni grill and u should go there if u want that kind of service.  We were stunned.  Made to feel as if we did not belong.  I was so upset that I did not eat my dish and ask that it be taken to go.  For what was to be a very special dining experience for us two foodies at an Andrew Zimmerman restaurant was utterly disappointing.  The treatment was appalling.  The sad part is that it was very clear we were unhappy but no one asked or took the time to figure out what was wrong.  Felt as if they couldnt wait til we left.  Frankly I could not get out of there fast enough.  Never ever been treated that way in a fine restaurant.  We ended up going to the mag mile for a meal.
Moderately even small servings, pleasant atmosphere, good service.
Your wine glass will never be lonely: great service (perhaps too good).  Food is incredible  Intimate experience.

Happy hour was the highlight. Drinks amd bites were fabulous. Dinner was underwhelming. Staff was excellent but I was surprised and disappointed that the dinner menu was uninspired and the food itself didn't have the finesse I expected with a Michelin star...

I totally didn't mind this cafe, the food is amazing, plus the washrooms were clean. It was a little fridgity inside, so that was not the very best. The service is great. I will absolutely consider returning once more if I get the chance. Me as well as my close friend ordered the toast as well as we were not disappointed. My one tip is to keep the cool exterior. Laters!
Very kind & delicious and creative foods but price $$$

Wow, what a total disappointment. I think the other reviews here must have never been to a true Michelin Star restaurant. The service was not just not good, it was bad. The food, yeah okay, but seriously, at a $100 a head for a four course tasting menue it should have been much better. Don't waste your one night in Chicago like I did...I should have gone for a pizza and it would have been much, much better.
Fairly decent place for lunch

Group of 6...we were in town for a conference  visiting from Calgary .Beautiful dining room. Outstanding service. Wine selections from sommelier were great  Everyone enjoyed their meals  For me  the highlight was the dessert. Pumpkin Cheesecake  with ice cream, salty toffee crunch on top  Wow. . Brilliant balance and flavour mix.
Delicious!! The Cavatelli was incredible!
Just had drinks at the bar. The bartender was incredible. Super friendly and makes great drinks
Delicious meal and attentive service. Nice ambiance. Solid restaurant, but not especially memorable.
Can not say enough great things about this place. Went here for lunch the service were very friendly and attentive. They were very accommodating to allergies, and the food tasted really great.
Great table in back & superb duck!
Great food! They take into consideration your diet and will accommodate, great service. I had a really great time.
Nice service and well decorated chocolate moose. Desdert wine was excellent!!

Great food. Wine list is incredibly interesting with off the beaten path wines. Best part - the sommelier doesnt hide somewhere and let you fumble through the list. Jenny came over and picked the perfect wine for us. She's great. Ask for her!
Not only is the food great and quite innovative for old school dishes. But also cheap (for chicago)

Wonderful meal!  We had the cheese board and grilled squid to start.  The squid was a balanced in flavors and textures.  The cheese board was perfect for sharing.  They also provided an amuse bouche of vegetable broth.  It had a beautiful light tomato and carrot base.  The sable fish I ordered was cooked to perfection.  The skin was so crisp while the fish was so tender.  In our party we also ordered the strip loin and pork tenderloin.  The sauce with the pork was really tasty. Thank you for a great birthday meal!
Great dinner, great service. It was a perfect place to celebrate a birthday for my wife. Have dinner without being rush
Upscale dining and service.
Awesome!
Tasty fish. White fish and poached cod were great

Beautifully presented in an understated ambience, Sepia is refined and doesn’t need to try hard to excel.  The team are expert and friendly, service is fluid and the quality and menu are exceptional.  Highly recommended.

Mother's day brunch was overpriced. The extra charge for drinks drove up the cost even more. The whole experience wasn't helped by finding out someone else's tab had been added to ours. When we pointed this out it was quickly rectified. We left agreeing we should have gone to The Publican instead.

This was my first time at a restaurant with a Michillen Star. Expectations were high and they exceeded them all. The food was excellent, presentation was also excellent. The staff was also exemplary. If I would ding them for anything is that the time between the 1st and 2nd course felt long. Perhaps, that is on me for not having proper expectations.
Love it
Worked with staff to plan a private event and everyone was quick to respond and very informative. Loved coordinating with Kali. Thank you for your time, Sepia!
Overpriced, mediocre overhyped food, so so service.

This place a has great happy hour.  I enjoyed a few drink by myself in a setting that was much less busy than I expected.  The best part is that my all time favorite cocktail, the French 75, was on their happy hour menu.  I will definitely be returning another time to get the full dining experience.
Bartender Kieth has excellent selection of Tequila and scotch. Halibut was excellent, properly prepared.  Relaxed atmosphere, comfortable environment. Now on my Chicago favorites list.
Good food and service
Love their cocktails!
The best finest restaurant in Chicago a restaurant that you must try over and over again

Dining atmosphere: I could barely hear my partner and tables were too close to eachother. Drinks: Good recommendations from our server. Many options. Appetizer/Entree: The flavors were acceptable but somehow off balance in an attempt to serve something 'out there.' This just could have been the palette of the current season on their seasonal menu. Dessert: Best part of the meal. The pastry chef presented something worthy of a Michelin star. Price: I have tasted better meals, at non Michelin restaurants within the same price range. It was not worth the money. The atmosphere was too noisy for the price.
Can't stop thinking about those braised duck thighs in Hibiscus Jus!
Great restaurant!  We did the tasting menu with wine pairings, and everything was perfect.  Great staff and nice ambience.  Not too loud, which I really appreciated.
Loved the ambience  and the food was amazing
Amazing food and staff... as always
Good happy hour drink specials. Great service. Small out door patio.

Great place to grab some amazing dinner, cheese was on point, charcuterie was spot-on as well. I had the rabbit, excellent. And the mascarpone cheesecake was the perfect amount of savory and sweet. Highly recommend getting reservations ahead of time which we did.
Service...food and ambiance: PERFECT! Our server's recommendations were very on point!
The filafel is mind blowingly amazing, and Id recommend anyone going to Chicago to try it. The cheesecake is a very good bite. The complimentary herbed butter was really good as well.
Well presented and flavorful food. Very attentive servers.

Sepia has an amazing aura - we were placed in the back room in the private dining area to host our party of 7. I thought overall the food was actually very delicious. We ordered one of every appetizer, and nearly every entree as well. What stood out:  Appetizers: - Gnocchi was amazing - The soup was absolutely delicious also - Cheese/meat platters were okay  Entrees: - The char was pretty good, although a bit small - The steak was not bad, it's a decent choice if you like steak and aren't too particular - The duck = BEST. Everybody who ordered it thought it was absolutely delicious  Desserts: - The free toffee they provided was probably the best - The pumpkin cake wasn't bad, but wasn't mind blowing with the ice cream either  I thought the service was very top notch. The only thing I didn't like was when I told them to order 1 of every appetizer and they didn't put in the order. Then I asked them if they ordered every appetizer for us, and he said no, and that we shouldn't since the soup is for one person. However, we all wanted a taste of the soup, so we ended up ordering it anyways.  Also, I was the host of the event and ordered all the wine. However, the waiter actually went to another person to ask him what wine he wanted to buy after, which I thought was awkward since I was hosting.  Overall, I think it's a great business venue, or for a date.
Outstanding tasting menu and wine pairings
I had the beef entree. The meat very good and the vegetables very tasty. The only regret was that we did not have time to order dessert as the service was too slow.
Great Place
Superior dining experience

Their happy hour is one of the best for the price! $7 drinks and small bites is great! We ate dinner there the day after valentines day though and it was definitely not up to par. Everything was good enough but the duck was tasteless and chewy. Hopefully the dinner was just a hangover from valentine's day before
Excellent, thoughtful service (Alex was great!), completely delicious food, peaceful atmosphere---always a memorable dining experience at Sepia.  We're already planning our next visit!

Happy hour is great. Good prices for great drinks. The dinner itself was ok but there were a few misteps (duck was super tough...). Not what I expected from a Michelin star restaurant. The service was ok
Excellent food
Sooooo good!
Loved it!!! Crowning glory of my Chicago visit! Thank you Sepia!
The food is good but portion size way too small, second time I went and I’m still hungry. There was no guidance for menu and they didn’t give me a dessert menu. Bad service. Again food is good.
Good Michelin restaurant.

Great meal overall, but would call out the Falafel entree as truly amazing. We added it to our tasting menu, since we had never thought of Falafel being a fancy option and we're curious to see what you could do with it. We were not disappointed and it was probably the highlight of an overall fantastic meal. Great spot, great seasonal menu and great wine and cocktail menu.
Food was good, but salmon was swapped in place of trout without me being notified.
It goes without saying that Sepia has amazing food.  I loved the atmosphere and the drink menu has very interesting and tasty selections

(Translated by Google) The beetroot of the appetizer is very sweet and delicious. The softness and hardness of the main dish is just right. The dessert plate is very beautiful. The bread just happens to be because the individual does not love the nut, so the friend said that the bread is also very good. The only shortcoming is that when pouring water, the water is often splashed on the table, and the waiter does not mean to wipe. I am sorry that I am a little bit clean and can't stand the water stain.  (Original) 前菜的甜菜根非常鮮甜好吃，主菜牛肩肉軟硬度也剛好，甜點擺盤非常美，麵包剛好因為個人不愛堅果，所以並沒有吃，但同行友人說麵包也很不錯。 唯一的小缺點是倒水的時候，常常把水濺到桌上，服務生也沒有要擦的意思，抱歉我個人有點小潔癖受不了水漬。
most beatiful dessert
Food was ok, service was ok. Everyone loved the pear sorbet, but thought the rest of our meal was average.
Great taste, small portions.

Five stars?  the food satisfies a gourmond, its delicate, adventuresome, well prepared and interesting.  The dining room is well layed out, sxcept the banguets, with generous spacing.  The wine list and service was outstanding, with interesting wines by the glass which makes pairing more eventful. The wine staff is superb
Sepia is one of my favorite fine dining restaurants in Chicago.   It's also a great place to grab a drink after work.   The cocktail program is excellent.
The food, service, atmosphere was exceptional. Will definitely visit again.

Very happy with the experience here overall. I thoroughly enjoyed drinking their Old Fashioned, it was easily in the top 5 old fashions I drank in all of 2017. The tasting menu was one of the better ones I've had around Chicago, too. You can't really go wrong here. Will come back.

trying to hard for my taste. They sacrifice tasty for exotic/exciting. So everything sounds great on paper, but just tastes okay generally... but you're paying for the paper description, not flavor...

I'll preface my review by saying that the service and ambiance were great! My critique is strictly about the food!  Imagine receiving a serving of tortellini with only 4 shells of pasta in an oversized bowl, no meat.  OR imagine macaroons the size of a marshmallow!  I am a foodie and consider myself to be a connoisseur of fine dining in Chicago, as I was born and raised in this city.  I came to this place for New Years Eve simply because they were offering a "six- course meal" dining experience for the evening.  At a whopping price of $125/ person, one would expect to leave full and satisfied.  However, what we received were six TASTE PORTIONS (if you can even consider them that) of entrees from their regular menu.  Although the dishes were served separately, everything we ate could have fit onto one large plate with space to spare.  The overall taste of the food left more to be desired, as there is nothing that I would absolutely have to try again. Needless to say,  I left this place still hungry, dissatisfied, and $300 less wealthy than I walked in.

Tried the tasting menu and 3/5 of the dishes were great. 2 were cold / undercooked / sold out; drinks were excellent as well. Even through all this Tangie was graceful and amazing. Please fix the inventory issues with food coverage and chef capability on a Saturday night. Could be a great place, but currently not enough attention paid to be worth a Michelin rating, at least for our visit.
Best meal I've ever had. Awesome service. Would definitely recommend to anyone.
Good ambiance, not very loud. Tasting menu was creative and delicious.

Good Overall. We went here for dinner during restaurant week. My favorite dishes were the Coffee Cured Beef and the Papardelle. My least favorite was the Veal, which tasted good, but was extremely rubbery and challenging to eat. I wouldn't mind coming back to try some more!
Happy hour specials are nice. New restaurant proxi is even better.

Always a delight to visit Sepia and enjoy their excellent cocktails. Their happy hour selection is surprisingly affordable, though personally I prefer their full menu. It's also great fun to challenge the bartender to make a bespoke cocktail based on your preferences: I've never been disappointed.

We went to Sepia for our anniversary dinner while visiting Chicago. It was our first Micheline star experience and I guess I had high expectations for our dinner. Service was lovely and attentive and the atmosphere great. Food was good but not to die for, some dishes were too solty but boyfriend'e rabbit was undercooked. If I was living in Chicago, I wouldn't go back anytime soon. I found that it was worth the price tag.
Trendy hotel
Deliciously designed offerings to bridge a past-future hunger and interest.
Nice setting, good food and great sommelier
The pork chop was excellent.

Food was 4.7, atmosphere was 4.0, service was 4.2, beer list was 2.9.  All of the food was very tasty.  Charcuterie was stellar and similar to Richmond Station (Toronto) in quality. The only dish that was off balance (too acidic with overpowering flavors of lemon/cilantro) was the squid appetizer.  Would have preferred if the olive oil cake was softer and less dry.  Minor things but I went in with low expectations because the West loop has been overhyped (Girl & Goat, Au Cheval, Lena Bravia were all big let downs).  Sepia held up to their Michelin star, and in my opinion was equal in deliciousness to band of Bohemia.  Service was great and the atmosphere was very nice (upscale modern).  The tables are really packed closely together which was a little annoying (often would feel staff brushing against you while doing their job), but at least the chairs were big and comfortable.  Costs approx 200 to fill us both up (3 appetizers, 2 mains, side of potatoes, and dessert).  I will be back.
Delicious food.
Wow! Great restaurant by Andrew Zimmern
